spec.title: CSS Flexible Box Layout Module Level 1

values.name: row
values.prose: The flex container’s main axis has the same orientation as the inline axis of the current writing mode. The main-start and main-end directions are equivalent to the inline-start and inline-end directions, respectively, of the current writing mode.

values.name: row-reverse
values.prose: Same as row, except the main-start and main-end directions are swapped.

values.name: column
values.prose: The flex container’s main axis has the same orientation as the block axis of the current writing mode. The main-start and main-end directions are equivalent to the block-start and block-end directions, respectively, of the current writing mode.

values.name: column-reverse
values.prose: Same as column, except the main-start and main-end directions are swapped.

values.name: <'flex-grow'>
values.prose: This <number [0,∞]> component sets flex-grow longhand and specifies the flex grow factor Info about the 'flex grow factor' definition.#flex-flex-grow-factorReferenced in: 7. Flexibility 7.1. The flex Shorthand 7.2.1. The flex-grow property 9.7. Resolving Flexible Lengths (2) 9.9.1. Flex Container Intrinsic Main Sizes (2) (3) (4) (5) (6) Substantive Changes and Bugfixes (2) (3) , which determines how much the flex item will grow relative to the rest of the flex items in the flex container when positive free space is distributed. When omitted, it is set to 1.

values.name: <'flex-shrink'>
values.prose: This <number [0,∞]> component sets flex-shrink longhand and specifies the flex shrink factor Info about the 'flex shrink factor' definition.#flex-flex-shrink-factorReferenced in: 7. Flexibility 7.1. The flex Shorthand (2) 7.2.2. The flex-shrink property 9.7. Resolving Flexible Lengths (2) 9.9.1. Flex Container Intrinsic Main Sizes Substantive Changes and Bugfixes (2) (3) , which determines how much the flex item will shrink relative to the rest of the flex items in the flex container when negative free space is distributed. When omitted, it is set to 1.

values.name: <'flex-basis'>
values.prose: This component sets the flex-basis longhand, which specifies the flex basis Info about the 'flex basis' definition.#flex-flex-basisReferenced in: 7.1. The flex Shorthand 7.1.1. Basic Values of flex 7.2.3. The flex-basis property 9.2. Line Length Determination (2) (3) (4) (5) 9.8. Definite and Indefinite Sizes Changes since the 19 November 2018 CR (2) (3) Substantive Changes and Bugfixes (2) (3) (4) (5) Clarifications (2) (3) (4) : the initial main size of the flex item, before free space is distributed according to the flex factors. <'flex-basis'> accepts the same values as the width and height properties (except that auto is treated differently) plus the content keyword: When omitted from the flex shorthand, its specified value is 0.

values.name: none
values.prose: The keyword none expands to 0 0 auto.

values.name: <number>
values.prose: The flex-grow property sets the flex grow factor to the provided <number>. Negative values are not allowed.

values.name: <number>
values.prose: The flex-shrink property sets the flex shrink factor to the provided <number>. Negative values are not allowed.

properties.name: flex-basis
properties.percentages: relative to the flex container’s inner main size
properties.computedValue: specified keyword or a computed <length-percentage> value

values.name: auto
values.prose: When specified on a flex item, the auto keyword retrieves the value of the main size property as the used flex-basis. If that value is itself auto, then the used value is content.

values.name: content
values.prose: Indicates an automatic size based on the flex item’s content. (This is typically equivalent to the max-content size, but with adjustments to handle preferred aspect ratios, intrinsic sizing constraints, and orthogonal flows; see details in § 9 Flex Layout Algorithm.)

warnings.name: flex
warnings.prose: This value causes an element to generate a flex container box that is block-level when placed in flow layout.

warnings.name: inline-flex
warnings.prose: This value causes an element to generate a flex container box that is inline-level when placed in flow layout.
